boardgame.name: Love Letter: Batman
boardgame.description: Love Letter: Batman is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash;4 players based on the original Love Letter game by Seiji Kanai. The deck consists mostly of criminals, with Joker being the most valuable card at #8, Harley Quinn at #7, and so on, with Robin showing up at #4 and Batman as #1, which is the guard in the original Love Letter. Your goal is either to hold _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; that is, have captured _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; the highest valued card at the end of the round or to be the final player active in the round._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;From a deck with only sixteen cards, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, using the power on that card to expose others and (possibly) knock them out of the round. If you use Batman's ability to KO someone (other than Robin), you score one point, with points being tracked via Batsignal tokens. If you're the final player active in the round or the player with the highest card when the deck runs out, then you score a point._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends following the round in which someone has seven or more points, and the player with the most points wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Alderac Entertainment Group (AEG5115) Take back the streets of Gotham City! The most notorious villains in Gotham City have escaped Arkham Asylum and it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s up to the Dark Knight to round them up and return them to their padded cells. Love Letter: Batman Edition is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2-4 players. Earn Batman Tokens by eliminating opponents and by winning each round for a new spin on the classic Love Letter!
Box and Clamshell available, please specify.

My copy of Love Letter: Batman has been played a few times. Please geek mail me if you would like photos or have questions about the game. Buyer will pay shipping and packaging costs (not my time, but the box and bubble wrap). If you have a shipping preference, geek mail me and let me know. Also, I live in the 21209 zip code (Baltimore, MD), so let me know if you would prefer to pickup the game and save us both time on shipping.
